caption: This is one of the best places I've ever eaten. It's a great experience that combines all your senses. I definitely recommend it. Service is superb as well. Will.go back when they reopen
Great experience and got all the food info we wanted from the helpful staff. Would highly recommend trying once.

My wife and I dined at Pineapple and Pearls for our 10th anniversary at Pineapple and Pearls.  Our experience left a lot to be desired. The food in it of itself was very good (4 stars). However, the captain (front of the house manager) lacked the necessary service skills for an establishment of this prestige. My wife when making the reservation asked for a center seating at the chef table. We were sat at the furthest left seating at the chef table. We alerted our server that we would like to move to the center seating that just came available as we sat down and they stated they had to check with the “captain.” The captain came over and was way over the top in trying to explain himself when the simple solution was to move to the center seats which were available. The captain said “I hear you are unhappy about the seating, your not missing anything. Behind the wood barrier is just another station... I can give you a tour of how everything works.... etc. The captain just came off over the top and just wasn’t genuine. Alex our server and the rest of the wait staff were tremendous.
Amazing experience, very different. Went there for my husband birthday and we had an amazing night with great food.

These are only a small fraction of the food pictures we took from our wonderful birthday celebration at P&P tonight. 11ish courses of diverse, delicious, and whimsical food! The staff there is nothing but friendly and personable, remembering our names throughout and adding personal touches. The whole experience is a treat and definitely recommend to anyone looking for a fine dining experience, look no further. We will be back!!
Fantastic meal.  Beautiful service.  Sit at the chef's counter if you can.

We unfortunately haven’t had a chance to eat here yet as we had to unexpectedly cancel our Valentine’s Day dinner plans due to a major family emergency. Pineapple and Pearls typically charges a fee for reservations cancelled so close to the actual date which is understandable given the amount of work they put into each meal. However, when I contacted the reservation team at Pineapple and Pearls and explained the situation they refunded our deposit in full. A special thank you to Nikki and the reservation team. You are a class act organization and we greatly appreciate the act of kindness during this difficult time. We cannot wait to eat there in the very near future. Based on how we were treated before even entering the restaurant I am sure the service is out of this world!

This was a once-in-a-lifetime, mind blowing experience in every way. Went for my wife’s 40th birthday. From the first step into the door until stepping out was immaculate in every sense. There were I think ten courses each with 6 drink pairings One of which was a Sherry from my wife’s birth year. The level of planning in thinking of that detail and delivering is astounding.  Yet this was typical of the perfect service given to us by Alex. The military timing of the service staff and kitchen was an amazing thing to watch and experience. The only deterrent from coming here more is the price but it is definitely worth a special occasion. It was super nice to pre-pay the entire bill and just be able to walk out after the dining experience was finished. I will definitely go back for that.
Amazing experience!

The food was good and I am glad I went once. Ultimately though it was a pretty meh experience. I did not come away with any memories of food that stood out. Service was fine, but not stellar. This is a solid four, but one of my less favorite Michelin star experiences.
Impressive array of small set dishes paired with flavorful and refreshing alcoholic beverages and excellent service. Nonetheless, the price tag of just under $500 is a bit steep.

While the food and service was good, I am not able to characterize our dining experience as outstanding or exceptional. Given the commitment in both time and cost, I had hoped for more from this small, chic restaurant.  The turbot was very good. However, too many dishes either were not executed well (e.g., both the lamb chop and lamb sausage arrived at room temperature, the fondue on the apple confit overwhelmed the rest of the desert flavors) or were so late in arriving that we were left wondering if the meal was over midway through the lengthy service.

Visiting my husband's family we escaped our toddler for a date night in D.C. and were blown away with Pineapple and Pearls.  It was amazing!  The food was fabulous, the staff were friendly, observant and could answer every question I asked.  We will definitely be back!
Don't go unless you are after an amazing experience! Like an exquisite tasting performance art piece!
The food here is amazing and I love the service! the atmosphere feels great and the service staff were polite and super professional! Would be back very soon!
Sooooooo amazing! Probably the best dining experience of the year. Such complex, yet delicate and subtle flavors... I can’t remember a better meal. Thank you!!!!
Went last night for my 27th bday. Absolutely delicious. Of course it’s very pricey, but worth the experience. The pairings were very well done. Delicious wines and courses.

Everything was amazing. My personal favorite was the breakfast, which was a sourdough french toast with blue cheese and truffle, and it was one of the best dishes I have ever had. The entire experience was simply Devine. Since we went to celebrate a birthday, we even got a parting gift of a signed menu, a pineapple candy shaped as a pearl, and they made a donation for each guest. I would definitely go back to celebrate another event.

Dined at the bar in early October. Might just have been the best meal of my life. Service was amazing, perfect portions, delicious in all respects. I had the non-alcoholic drink pairing and it was quite delightful. Go here, you’ll love it.

Very vibrant environment. Do the all you can eat, they come in small dishes which gives you the opportunity to try every dish.  The portions are good for satisfying the curious mind.  Very friendly staff as well.

Amazing experience at the chefs counter! We got 10 courses and each bite was filled with unique texture and flavor combinations.  Service was also flawless, which is to be expected from a two Michelin star restaurant. It really held up to the hype. I highly recommend!  ig: @whetyourappetites

Lovely dining experience all-around. The food is excellent without being over-the top. It innovates without challenging the palate too much so you don't need to be a particularly adventurous eater to enjoy it but still won't find it boring if you are. Friendly, knowledgeable staff and an artistic and inviting decor make for a pleasant and relaxed, but not casual feel.  For those questioning dress code, anything less formal than a tuxedo and more formal than short sleeve shirt and jeans and you won't feel over or under-dressed.  Price is as would be expected for a place with a pair of Michelin stars, but is worth the cost. It is somewhat less pricy than the other, perhaps more famous two-star DC spot, Minibar.

Did bar seating. It was very good and I want to give it 4.5 or 5 stars, but you can’t leave tip on credit card. Don’t believe they mentioned tip is cash only and I didn’t have cash (had to borrow from a friend). That was a little awkward (asking the people who worked there) and annoying. But service was great and food was good.

What an incredible dinner we had here. The food is excellent and the service is impeccable. My wife was pregnant when we went and also gluten and dairy intolerant. They somehow adjusted the menu for her (we told them ahead of time) and made her feel right at home.  They even sent us home with breakfast. Also, dessert is like 4 courses. It just never stops and I don't mind. Love love love this place.
The wine and drinks here are so tasty and good

Don't let the pricetag scare you away-it's worth every penny. We've eaten at several "foodie" locations, including a Michelin star restaurant in Paris, but that doesn't hold a candle to Pineapple and Pearls. Every individual in the restaurant treats you like you're the only person in the place. It's a world-class experience with world class dishes. We sat at the chef's table and were blown away by the attention to cleanliness and detail. I, unfortunately, fell ill 4 courses in and had to leave my wife to experience the rest of the meal alone. They went above and beyond to ensure her experience, even alone, was unforgettable. We will definitely be back!
Attentive service, ok-food (it’s good but over-praised), creative cuisines.

Amazing, start to finish. The 150 layer lasagna, the monkfish with etouffee, the toffee pudding tart...the wine pairing. Pro tip: go for the wine pairing, you don't need to opt for deluxe mind you...but they do put together a nice selection of wines for every pallet.
It was wonderful! Our bartender was knowledgeable in everything severed and was a pleasure to talk to.  The food was delicious and came out at a good pace.
The food was lovely, the ambience was peaceful/quiet, and the staff were charismatic, helpful, and knowledgeable.  A night out here is both an experience and an opportunity to have great food.

Amazing experience, well worth the money.  Staff was very accommodating, let them know if you don't like certain types of food!  Will (at the bar) was awesome! Great conversation, sadly the ice luge was inoperable the night we went, would have been fun! ;) ;)
Wow. Yum. Wow. Yum. Eat here. Forget about time and $$s. Great service. Great eats. Just do it.
Absolutely fantastic & 2 Michelin stars well deserved.
One of the best restaurants we've been to - on both taste and service
Great meal with Sally and Will
The best! Unrivaled dining experience!

An absolutely unforgettable experience, featuring some of the most innovative and flavorful dishes I've ever had. We opted for the chef's table experience with the luxury wine pairing and the optional course.  As we entered we were provided with a cool towel while we waited for our table, and were offered a drink to get us started. After we sat down we were introduced to the restaurant and service as our courses were prepared. The service started with a table-side cocktail with a series of bite size pastry snacks, before moving on to a number of sea food dishes, eventually ending up at a barbecued lamb dish. The drink pairings were excellent, and included a number of vintage wines that are usually unavailable to purchase unless you have a connection in the industry. The highlight of the meal was definitely the optional Caviar Taco's and the Creole Style Blackened Monkfish.  After the meal was over our server offered us coffee and gave us a signed menu by the kitchen staff as we were celebrating our first anniversary, which was a really nice way to top off the evening.  Overall I highly recommend Pineapple & Pearls for a special occasion, it's worth its 2 Michelin starred rating and provides a memorable experience that you'll cherish for time to come.
We had a really great experience here. The service is top notch and it was a lot of fun to try all their carefully curated dishes and pairings. We'll be back - I highly recommend them.

Experience at the bar, not in the dining room. Friendly staff but definitely not 2 Michelin star worthy. Sitting way too close to restrooms so odors constantly present ... 2 Michelinstars you say ?? As for the food, forget stars of any kind. Dry lasagna, simple lamb bbq with ordinary salad , small portions that let you on your appetite...  will not go back.
Amazing. Simply amazing.

If 6 or 7 or 10 stars was possible, Pineapple and Pearls would deserve it. The food was phenomenal, the service was excellent, the ambiance was wonderful. The only fault with the restaurant is they wouldn't allow me to live there. It was one of the best meals I've ever had without exaggeration.

It was everything I had hoped for and heard about. The food was fantastic and service rhythmic.  A wonderful and tasty culinary experience from the start with the tableside sakura vermouth martini to dessert. Great birthday experience.
Amazing, simply delicious. The food, staff, decor and plating is exactly on point. This is a wonderful choice for a special, intimate meal.

My 2nd time here and it was even better than the 1st. Sat at the Chef's Bar and was able to see most of the action go on. All the servers were very attentive and friendly. Definitely recommend this place. The price to me was definitely worth it. Not sure what else expecting from fine dining. Both my uncle and I were satisfied and were full at the end. There's no tipping at the end. All included in the price when reserving online.

This is a restaurant that charges $335 for dinner.  It's good, at times very good, but its not, as discussed below,  worth what they're asking you to pay.  The waitstaff can be over the top.  Way too much talking and posturing at times from an overly long and, frankly, silly greeting (we're going to have fun tonight) to a detailed description of the vermouth they're pouring into your martini or a several minute discussion of the salad and dressing they're making for you  (we're talking here about a simple green salad with a vinaigrette dressing.)  The food was often, but not always, very good; the portions were impossibly small.  I truly left, after 2 1/2 hours, still hungry.  The main course, as it was referred to by the waiter, was a beef strip loin accompanied by a single endive that was gone in four bites. The last three courses were all deserts of a sort, accompanied by a somewhat sweet wine.  No cheese course which would have certainly helped. And the wine, none of which I believe was from special vintages or vineyards, was quite meagerly poured and yes, they would refill your glass if you asked, but really, there should have been a more generous pour to begin with.  I appreciate the concept here, but I really believe Pineapple and Pearls needs to modify their server's practices, revisit what and how much they're serving and open up a bit on the not terribly expensive wines/drink they serve.  This, as we experienced it, was just not worth $335.

Don't let the pricetag scare you away-it's worth every penny. We've eaten at several "foodie" locations, including a Michelin star restaurant in Paris, but that doesn't hold a candle to Pineapple and Pearls. Every individual in the restaurant treats you like you're the only person in the place. It's a world-class experience with world class dishes. We sat at the chef's table and were blown away by the attention to cleanliness and detail. I, unfortunately, fell ill 4 courses in and had to leave my wife to experience the rest of the meal alone. They went above and beyond to ensure her experience, even alone, was unforgettable. We will definitely be back!
Best in DC!
We sat at the chef station and got one alcohol pairing and one nonalcohol pairing. We had such a lovely time and loved experiencing the unique combinations executed to perfection

Did bar seating. It was very good and I want to give it 4.5 or 5 stars, but you can’t leave tip on credit card. Don’t believe they mentioned tip is cash only and I didn’t have cash (had to borrow from a friend). That was a little awkward (asking the people who worked there) and annoying. But service was great and food was good.
There are no other words to describe Pineapples and Pearl's other than AMAZING! This is a food lover's must and an experience like no other. The Michelin stars say it all. Go here and experience.
Great food and staff, dinner at the bar is shorter course than inside the dining room. Parking is also a challenge
Obviously everything was fantastic, but not relative to the price or to other Michelin 3 star places.

A must Visit in DC..There arent enough superlatives  to describe the amazing food, paired spectacularly with wine, presented by angelic, attentive, hospitable, and knowledgeable staff..Three hours you wished would extend twice as long.

After a disappointing experience at what was supposed to be a there star restaurant in Healdsburg, CA, Pineapple and Pearls was an amazing surprise. Service was excellent, wine pairings were very good (though pours were a little small), and the food was incredible -- inventive combinations and all were very good, with a couple (like the foie gras chawanmushi) really incredible.  If that other place gets three stars, this place in comparison should have at least that many.
Amazing food ! Perfect service !! Treat yourself .
Great restaurant ... seating at the chef's counter is a little too close together.

I originally left this review on trip advisor.  The staffs here are young & charming. They try their best to accommodate you. You'll leave the dining experience thinking that they are extremely well-trained and professional. Unfortunately, I would not recommend this place for anyone looking for an exquisite and unique food experience.  My girlfriend and I had the bar experience with wine pairing. Their pairing was well thought out. I wasn't a big fan of the smoky beer, but I understood the appeal. Every other drink was decent and definitely worth the additional $60 dollar(might have been $65).  The food here was overall subpar. The biggest disappointment came from the monkfish & the duck. They were both over-seasoned. I had to go to the restroom twice to spit it out. We later realized that the sauces served with those dishes were the culprits. I had to wipe off the sauce from the proteins before eating. The proteins themselves were well-seasoned. The line cook in charge of the sauces definitely screwed up. The bun that came with the duck was also overly seasoned. This ended up in the toilet as well. I believe this was my first Michelin two experience where I had to spit the food out. It was definitely a numbing experience.  The desserts were good. The sweetness definitely helped me recover from the extremely over-seasoned fish & duck.  I am genuinely confused as to why this place has two stars. I believe they will lose their star if the food suffers like this in the future.  If you are visiting DC, I would recommend avoiding P&P and visiting other fine dining establishments. I would personally recommend 'Reverie' if you are a fan of duck dishes. 'Reverie' waitstaffs are underwhelming but... hey, they just opened. I'm sure the restaurant will mature over the months.  If you live here & you love food as much as I do, give other places a visit before P&P. Chef Patrick O'Connell's establishment will give you an extremely unique and delicious experience. A bit out of the way, but definitely... most definitely worth.  I really do hate myself for having to write this review. I never had such a terrible food experience in a Michelin-rated restaurant. I mean no disrespect to all the hard-working staffs here at P&P. It was probably a one time mistake from the line cook. Nonetheless, I left the establishment thinking that I paid money not for the food but only for the service of extremely pleasant waitstaffs.
A truly amazing experience! We sat at the bar with Will, who was able to capstone the killer food being put out by the kitchen!

The single best dining experience I've ever had. From the seating allowing us to watch the chefs to the service that was both attentive and unobtrusive, details were important. That said, most importantly each dish was an image of perfection and a taste explosion that was varied, unexpected and superlative in its execution.
Amazing experience. Great service and food

I have been here twice in the past 60 days. It is a blind tasting menu.  1st visit - I felt that the staff did a good job informing me about the courses at the start of my meal, and gauging my preferences based on that conversation. Although I really enjoyed the cuisine, I still felt like I could have eaten more food by the end of the meal.  2nd visit - I went last week, and it was a horrible experience from beginning to end. We stood there for 10 min waiting to be seated. Once seated, I was never asked about my alcohol preferences for the course  pairings, although the couple next to me was asked that. The courses were not explained to me, and it resulted in me having to send back 4 of my savory courses, some of which were not supplemented with any alternative course. At the end of my meal, I expressed my dissatisfaction with Madison (mgr), who said she would contact me to discuss it further in the next few business days. Not only have they not contacted me, but I sent an email to the restaurant 5 days ago which they have not responded to. Last night I sent a text directly to the reservation desk, and again no response. I WILL NEVER RETURN TO THIS RESTAURANT. The Inn at Little Washington has 3 stars, and gave me more food at a higher quality for less money, with much better customer service! I don't care if they have 2 stars, the way this restaurant is managed and what they deliver for the price point is a joke.
Overrated

Absolutely wonderful from start to finish! Ate at the bar. The staff was incredibly attentive and personable. Even with the beverage pairing we didn't leave feeling too full or that we had too much to drink.

How can you not give it 5 stars? Pretty incredible experience.  The wine/beverage-food pairings are nearly perfect, but I will also say that my friend chose the non alcoholic route and the juice & other beverage pairings were just down right amazing. You are not missing out if you find that you are the designated driver. We sprung for the extra white truffle course and I can only say, it is worth every penny. Of special note for me, the hot milk punch & cocktail snacks (smoked wagyu tallow tart and rosemary peconic escargot vol-au-vent), monkfish en papillote and the mole sauces. And of course the truffles.
Amazing.

Get ready for a truly special and enjoyable evening. A truly memorable experience.  As soon as you enter Pineapple and Pearls, they make it clear this is your night and they are there to take care of you.  We were started with a delicious white tea while we waited and then were seated in the beautiful dining area. You will be stricken by how quiet it is despite the chefs working right there. They demonstrate discipline. There is no drama here. Just absolute focus on making delicious courses.  We traveled along a 10 or so tasting course. Each course is gorgeous looking. Served beautifully and delicious. The pairings - both alcoholic and non-alcoholic were spot on. What I like is it’s not just wine on the alcohol side. They had some truly delicious and unique ciders tonight and a smoked beer that was perfect.  We loved all the dishes. I would say that we enjoyed the desserts more on our last visit. They were more innovative and surprising. These weren’t bad, they just weren’t sensational.  They focus on taking care of any dietary concerns. In fact, you hear the entire chef gang  calling and repeating the needs of each visitor as they begin.  It was a beautiful evening. Fit for a special occasion.

This was my first Michelin two star restaurant. I have to say thr best thing about this meal was the food to drink pairing. So much of thr time I feel like the food and drink barely pair together. At P&P they really do a great job at making sure the food and drink are on thr same level. The duck was amazing and I could have eaten the whole thing. It was presented in two ways both just as tasty. The beef carpacio was also very smooth. There were so many little touches that went a long way to making the meal special. The friendly greetings from the staff. The warm towel and tea when you first enter. I would have added an extra star if I would have felt more of the dishes were outstanding. This was still worth the money for me.
The food and atmosphere was a Mind Blowing experience! Corey, our host/server, was absolutely Amazing!! A Must Go!
Every course is a work of art. Kitchen seats provide the added bonus of seeing the artists at work.
Top rated service and courses.
Amazing experience. Don't pass this opportunity.

Sat at the bar. Will was a killer host/bartender. The snacks, courses, drink pairings, and gift were superb.  Such a pleasant evening. Everyone was concerned about any food allergies or intolerances and willing to accommodate. The foie gras nigiri was the best bite of the evening.

Very intimate experience - service excellent - I felt like Royalty.  Flavorful bites with cocktail pairings that enhanced the course.  I would have loved to have a cheese course.  Definitely worth the bread ($$$$$)

Really not worth the price and embarrassing to Michelin that it got any stars.  The few positives of the night include great mole with tortillas and a great first drink.  The overall vibe is "hipster brunch" and this place represents all that is bad about DC.  The music was weird, the menu didn't flow, and really only two courses stood out.  The chef must have just discovered beurre blanc because they put it on everything.  The drink paring was aggressive and the experience felt more like rushing a frat than enjoying a a nice dinner.  The servers seemed to be acting, whereas at Minibar everything felt legitimate.  They churched up trout roe, charging 75 extra per person, when you can buy an entire jar of the same quality for 35.  If you are wanting a great dining experience, go to Minibar.  If you have been to all of the other Michelin-rated restaurants in the area, just go to McDonalds and save yourself 500 bucks.
Amazing experience!

A seating at the chef’s counter is the best place to experience the choreography of the chefs and wait staff.  I felt like I was simultaneously at the ballet, an art exhibit and, of course, a very fine dining establishment.  The food and beverage pairings were outstanding; the service impeccable; serving pieces and flatware interesting and unusual; and the atmosphere romantic and whimsical.  It wasn’t just the best meal I’ve ever had, it was also an amazing experience.
There's not much to really say, it will be the culinary experience of a lifetime, and it's worth every penny.
Amazing adventure in food and drink pairings!  The service was over the top without being too much.  All in all a fabulous evening!

I visited PnP for my birthday and it is Un-be-lievable! Quality and careful thought in every single item in the place. The servers and bar staff go over the top in customer service. Each item had its own unique china for extra flair. If I'm ever in DC again, I'll definitely be returning 👍👍👍
Spectacular service...very inventive food...very special evening with friends! Kudos to the chefs!
Amazing, but too much sugar!
Pricey, but totally lived up to the hype.
Really enjoy this atmosphere.
One of the best restaurants! The food was very tasty.
Definitely in the running for best meal of my life! Each course was clever, delicious, and beautiful. Service was top notch.
Perhaps the best culinary experience of my life
We sat at the chef station and got one alcohol pairing and one nonalcohol pairing. We had such a lovely time and loved experiencing the unique combinations executed to perfection.

Progressive and elegant dining experience. Food is well prepared and good drink tasting. Service is pretty amazing but you are paying for the experience more than anything else.  I do have to say for Thursday evening, restaurant was more than half empty, wondering if the last increase in price few months ago turn some folks off.
Amazing dinning experienced, sitting at the chef's corners is highly recommended. Worth every dollar.
Was good each time I went. Fast but better service the last time.

I really enjoyed my experience here. From the moment you enter you’re greeted with a moist towel and a delicious tea. The service is top notch. It started a little too slow for my taste but it picked up later. My favorite dish was the duck. Every bite you take is an explosion of flavors on your mouth. I was worried that there wouldn’t be enough food but by the time I was done with my last dessert I was fully satisfied.

Great place with a great atmosphere.  Reservations are required and can be hard to come by.  Dinner is a 12 course tasting menu with a beverage tasting.  Due to the small size, it can be a little noisy and a little cramped.  In my opinion the best experience is to eat at the chefs table.
This restaurant is impeccable, even the procurement of glassware is amazing! Every detail is thoughtfully displayed!
There are no words! Truly an experience not to be missed for those who love fine dining with a pinch of whimsy. The menu constantly changes and the staff clearly love what they do. Worth every penny.
There's not much to really say, it will be the culinary experience of a lifetime, and it's worth every penny.

My favorite Michelin Star restaurant, better than minibar and the inn at little Washington and also half the price, it’s seriously amazing, service, food quality, innovative ingredients, ugh just the very BEST
Amazing tasting menu, although I'd love to see the a la carte menu as well. Some things were a miss for me, but the ones that were good, hit home
Fantastic
Excellent little adventure.

This is certainly one of the top restaurants in DC, maybe the best one. It's small and nearly always full, so reservations must be made well in advance. I've gone several times, but have never managed to get anything other than bar seating. It provides a wondrous tasting menu which includes either alcoholic or non-alcoholic beverage pairings. In fact, you'll be served beverages and hot towels the minute you come in the door, to prepare for your meal.  The bar seating is actually very nice, because you can see the inner workings of the kitchen right in front of you. It's almost as much fun watching the kitchen as eating the food! The chefs have a call-and-response routine where they announce what is going to whom, and it sounds a bit like a pirate crew might.  The dishes are very small as befits a tasting menu, and you don't order anything, or even know what's on the menu in advance. If you're vegetarian or have other dietary needs, you just tell them when you're making your reservations and they'll take care of you. They give you a copy of that night's menu when you leave, so you can remember what you ate, but each dish is pretty complicated and intricate, and it's hard to remember exactly what everything was without the menu! The service is impeccable, of course.  At some restaurants, ones I like even, tasting menus can seem like a bit of a slog. Here, though, it's more like an adventure to see what will happen next. The waitstaff is very good about explaining in detail what you're getting, how to eat it and so on.  I hope you enjoy it as much as I did!
Amazing food, wonderful ambiance and great staff. Highly recommend sitting at the chefs table!

Pineapple and Pearls will set you back a pretty penny, that's a given. The care and attention to detail  directed towards the food and experience make the cost absolutely worth it. You'll leave feeling like your good friend is a hell of a cook.  If you love good food, good wine, and an amazing experience, you must try Pineapple and Pearls.

This is the best restaurant in Washington at this time (May 2018).  It is very expensive ($325 per person). There is no menu; they bring you food in the form of a tasting menu with 11 courses but each course is tiny so it is not too much food. The service is generally excellent (one tiny screw up - I said I was allergic to (hard) shell fish but liked all kinds of  other seafood. They started to bring our table of 4 the tasting menu but they assumed I could not eat ANY seafood so they gave me different items. By the second course we realized their error and they "course corrected".  The price includes a wine pairing with about 7 different wines. I don't drink much so my pairing was non-alcohol.  It turns out they have a non-alcohol paring that is fabulous. I would recommend, for a party of two, have one person get the non-alcohol paring and one person get the wine pairing that way you can experience both.  Positive: Each dish usually has several flavors and textures that work very well together (even if they seem very unlikely). The service is excellent. The ambiance is relaxed (but definitely upscale).  (Minor) Negatives:  The location does not have any obvious place to park.  They say they have valet parking but you would not know that.  The valet parking is actually around the corner, about a block away, between G & E streets (with nobody standing out front of the restaurant directing you). You would be better off taking a taxi or uber. I don't think they take walk ins,  certainly not on weekends. When making a reservation on a weekend, it is really tough - 5 weeks in advance and plan on a 5 pm reservation on a Friday. The restaurant does not have a name on the outside, just an address (715 8st SE). None of the above effects the quality of the food just minor annoyances.
Good food and a short weight in conjunction with very polite staff. Was able to find seating in a decent amount of time.

Pineapple & Pearls has a prodigious reputation that has bestowed upon them a handful of accolades including two Michelin stars, one of only three restaurants in the D.C. area to receive two stars. So you know this place is legit.  For our sixth anniversary, the BF and I booked reservations for the Chef's Counter. We love to watch cooks prepare food, so this was the perfect spot. Definitely the best seats in the house! Currently, the price for the Chef's Counter and the Dining Room is $280/person. This includes all the courses, beverage pairings, tax, and gratuity. If you don't want alcohol, the price drops to $255.  Your credit card is charged $140 when you book, and the other half is charged the day of the reservation. Just a note that starting tomorrow, April 3, prices are increasing to $325/person!  Although on the more expensive side of restaurants, I think P&P is well worth its price tag. This is the hottest restaurant in D.C. for a good reason. And contrary to popular belief that $$$$$ and fine dining = stuffy and pretentious, that is the opposite for P&P. The atmosphere is warm, inviting, and enticing. I love the modern feel and look of this place.  The food is phenomenal. We had 11 courses of perfectly composed, creative dishes. You're taken on a journey through these dynamic courses. We started with chips and mole dip and advanced to abalone panna cotta, bone-in turbot (more restaurants need to do this!), pierogi with black truffle and potato skin, pork with pommes Anna, and Tête De Moine (cheese served in thin shavings topped with hazelnut praline and black truffle honey). Each course is matched with a thoughtfully selected wine pairing that enhances the dish. We splurged and requested the truffled ice cream sundae bar with white sturgeon caviar, which sounds bizarre but is truly genius (the way the caviar pairs with ice cream and ice cream toppings is so wondrous). While it is an additional $70/person, I highly recommend this.  Everyone at Pineapple & Pearls takes exceptional care of you. From the moment you walk in, you're greeted with warm towels and a welcome cocktail. Our server was so attentive, friendly, and accommodating. We felt like we were the only people in the restaurant under their care. The staff was so thoughtful with their handwritten anniversary notes and the gorgeous cake they prepared for us.  Our meal was one of the most memorable (and we've had our share of expensive, noteworthy meals!), and it's something that we can share for a long time.
Exceptional dining experience.

Reservations are a bit difficult to get if you aren't planning a month in advance, but it's always a good idea to put your name on the wait list and maybe you will luck out.  The service was very accommodating and friendly.  They prepared hand made notes and a cake to celebrate my wife's birthday.  While portions are bite  sized, there were about 12 courses so you will not leave hungry.  I highly recommend going here...while the cost is significant, the experience is worth it.
Not surprising that Pineapple and Pearls is a great experience.
Phenomenal. Most impressed with their nonalcoholic parings, so important when you don’t drink to be treated as good as those that do.
Simply amazing!  Such a unique and special dining experience.
Unforgettable food, service, and wine. Nice decor.
Best meal of my life
Amazing experience and excellent staff.  They make you feel right at home and everything is taken care of.

I went online and saw that one seat was open the bar area- which is much less $ than a table price, and more readily available.  so, I sat by myself, in complete and total food bliss, learning about various flavors and techniques, taken care of by mindful but not overbearing staff, and given so many little treats (including a to go bag with their pressed coffee and chocolates!) it made the experience worthy of #1 restaurant in DC.
The best meal, service and experience. Exceptional across the board.
Amazing meal! The food and service lived up to and surpassed the hype.
Best meal we've had in DC. Great celebratory night out
Incredible. Indescribable.
We didn't see valet option until after we parked down the block.   When we first walked in their greeting was a little awkward, but the rest of the evening was awesome.

Pineapple & Pearls is hands down the best meal I've ever had. From the welcome cocktails to the personalized service, the entire experience feels like home. They do nice touches that all restaurants of this caliber should do - have you pay in advance so you never have to see a check, refill your glasses at no additional charge if one member of your party likes a bit more, and are more than willing to give you seconds and thirds on coffee. I've come twice and both times left utterly delighted. It's currently $280 for drink, food, tip and tax but is going up to $325 in April.

Let's be clear - it's amazingly delicious and the service is fantastic. Every person in the kitchen and dining room clearly knows everything about each dish and they work together to make your night wonderful. They deliver an experience that well deserves their place at the top of everyone's restaurant lists in the area.

Best overall dining experience in DC.  I'm not a food critic or chef so can't compare on a pure cuisine level but I thoroughly enjoyed my experience here.  I preferred it to Eleven Madison Park, which is highly touted as having remarkable service.  The dishes are always fun and enjoyable regardless of ones experience with fine dining.

0/7 would not recommend, my parents placed a reservation for one of their birthdays, but had a multiple series of unfortunate events, the restaurant refused to cancel and refund the reservation even after being told the circumstances. They were very cold and impersonal, absolutely not how customer service should be. 0/10 would not make a reservation again
Amazing.
The best food and atmosphere I've experienced, probably in years!
Amazing, beautiful food. My favorite in DC. Sit at the kitchen bar and watch the serenity of the kitchen. It's like watching ballet. But it's really all about the food.
Great dining experience

For the $280 pre-pay ticket, you the full tasting menu with tax, tip, and generous drink pairings included! What a refreshing change from other two and three star Michelin spots that charge double or even triple this amount.  The most standout part of my dinner experience was the service - everyone was friendly and so darn likable! You are greeted with a hot towel and a glass of dry cava while you wait. Then you go into a stunning dining room with an open kitchen. I especially liked the pearl-like light fixtures and the 3D wall art.  The presentation of the food was lovely, but the flavors weren’t all there. Some dishes were under seasoned (Bass Veronique), and some were way too salty (Beggars’ Purse). The Wagyu main was pretty forgettable. I did love the unique savory Pecorino Cake and Pesto Ice cream dessert.  For drink pairings, I liked the option of picking an "eclectic" or more traditional pairing. I got to experience both and thought the traditional pairing went with the meal better, though I enjoyed the eclectic options by themselves. My favorite drink was probably the rainwater Madeira.  After dinner, we got a tour of the kitchen and met Chef Aaron Silverman and the friendly GM. We were given bags with butter, jam, menus, and a handwritten note that I later realized was mass printed (very convincing though!)  Timing, while pretty good, was a little off at times. The total dinner time was just over three hours for our party of three - on the longer side for 10 courses.  Overall I had a fun experience at P&P and the staff was wonderful, I just wish the food were a little more memorable.
Sublime
Awesome, creative cuisine!
Truly fine dining
Absolutely worth the reservation, cost, and flight.

One of the best dining experiences I've ever had. Worth every penny, especially for a special occasion. The food was phenomenal. Service impeccable, of course. We loved sitting at the chef's counter--watching the chefs cook and plate the courses really adds to the experience and I highly recommend it. Pro tip: there is no corkage fee if you sit in the main dining room or at the chef's counter. Also, we did the earlier seating (I think it was at 5:15), which worked out really well because we didn't end up finishing our meal until a little after 8 PM.
It is a great shame that the passion, joy and enthusiasm to savour great wine and cuisine does NOT extend to its newish sibling next door.
Worth every penny.  Everything you've read about and more.

I don't understand how this place only has 2 Michelin stars.  I had the non-alcoholic pairing with my tasting and all the drinks were so creative.  As soon as you walk in for your dinner, they make sure you have the best experience.  I had some dietary restriction which they were so kind to accommodate. Love this place.  Everything is included and you don't have to fuss with a check.
Excellent. Little Pearl has the most decadent pastries. Can't wait for them to re-open. This is a slice of heaven.
It's the best place too eat food and become full because it's so yummy go there when you are hungry and don't want to make your own food go there.
Amazing. Masterful. Memorable. Wish I could celebrate every milestone at this place.

My, the owner sure thinks highly of this place.  $280 for a 2 hour "experience?"  All I see are large plates and small portions as well as a rather arrogant attitude. Anyway, thanks for the head's up.  You just saved me  280 bucks.
Wonderful
The best little atmosphere with great coffee from The Passengers and their options for non dairy milk is amazing! Try their white sesame milk chai latte!
Fantastic chai tea, actually made from scratch and not from concentrate or powder. Always kind friendly folks. Cinimom roles are also amazing.
Great place with a posh vibe. Recommend the frittata, and the green tea iced tea lemonade.

Simply amazing!!! today 7/14 was my first time trying this restaurant thanx to a recommendation from a friend who suggested the chicken sandwich the bread 🍞 was soft, the favors were popping and now I'm in love 😍 I'm looking forward to trying everything on the menu @aboutthatfoodlife_
Might honestly be the best restaurant in the city. Highly recommended.
Excellent Cobb salad
Food and service are both impeccable.
Great space

Excellent at the bar! I bought a ticket for one and ate at the bar. I decided to treat myself to some fine dining but I was not drinking so I took advantage of the mocktail pairing which was amazing. I'm going to compare this to the neighboring Rose's Luxury and minibar, it is just as good. Not as crowded as Rose's Luxury. Like minibar, I had the eating at the bar experience but not the quirky atmosphere nor did I see the theater of cooking. The dishes range from tiny 3 bite items to dishes that are a bit heftier. They were mostly inventive dishes, such as the potato ice cream encrusted with caviar. There were several dishes, I don't remember how many, and I found myself very full at the end of the night. I was so full I had to get the last dishes to-go. Service was lovely.
It truly is an experience. If I had to pick one word to sum it up, it would be "fun". Beyond that, you just have to try it for yourself.
Sublime.
Cider with ginger was tasty. Treats are often top notch.
Unreal culinary experience.

The hype is real, the food is great, the staff is wonderful, though at $150 (and soon $180) a head for the base price, I'm not convinced it's truly the best place to eat in DC.  At this price tier, I found myself wanting to save a little and just go next door to their original spot at Rose's Luxury, or just go the extra mile (and $150) and just eat at Minibar.
I came for the signature pastry and it blew my damn mind 👍
I've only had the coffee here, which is some of the best in The District.
An amazing dining experience.  Well worth the time and wait!
A "must-have" DC experience. Exceptional food with exceptional service. And they give you a breakfast treat on your way out!
❤ Love that chicken sandwich! Notice the hand applied gold foil sticker on the coffee cups.

Well, we didnt even make it to dinner because I was very ill and we were unable to change our reservations! This was to be our Christmas present from our children. They chose December 29th, which would have been a great date had I not gotten sick  So, our children are out $250, we did not enjoy a dinner at Pineapple and Pearls - nothing to show for their hard earned money.  A very unfortunate way to run a business.We will not try again as this policy seems absurd

Amazing experience, staff is very knowledgeable and will answer any questions you have, as well as explain each dish in great detail. I'd recommend the beverage pairing for the full experience, because there are some drinks you're not likely to have ever tried before.

I can only speak for the espresso drinks which are PHENOMENAL! Since I'm a barista, I'm super critical of espresso bars, how they're presented, latte art, etc. and Pineapple and Pearls nails it! The bar itself is minimalistic, but hip and cool. The drinks are smooth and done correctly. They serve breakfast items including sandwiches and pastries. The shop itself is incredibly small, so don't expect to sit down to drink your coffee unless you plan on sitting outside. It's also extremely easy to pass up unless you're looking for it, as there are no signs even suggesting it is a coffee shop.
Cool cafe on Capitol hill. Excellent coffee and espresso. Very hidden! Behind an unmarked door.
Flabbergastingly good.
Makes you love food in new and unexpected ways

Service was warm and friendly. Food is different, adventurous and creative, though not all worked out to taste good. The non-alcoholic pairing was not worth the $75 dollar price and I wouldn't do that again next time. Overall it is worth trying.
Some excellent dishes but also a couple of flops which should not happen at this level and price point. Very good service.

Splendidly amazing. All I can say is you feel completely cared for here. After learning of my food restrictions (vegetarian and gluten free) I was taken on a culinary journey equivalent to my "no restrictions" friend. Every course was uniquely adjusted to accommodate me while still mirroring the essence of the dish. While most will realize this is a great place by it having two Michelin stars, I still needed to somehow express my gratitude and deep, heartfelt thanks for a wonderfully unique and beautiful meal.
The best breakfast sandwiches I've ever had.
Seating is almost non-existent, but the coffee is top-notch and the food is fantastic.
Great coffee and gourmet, expertly crafted pastries.  Very good breakfast wraps too.
Great coffee, great food, expensive prices. Only a limited number of seats.

They have the best coffee setup I've seen in any Café.  Espresso ground on a Mahlkönig Peak (Twin, even!), made with a Slayer, and batch filter ground on an EK 43. If I had unlimited money, this is the machinery I'd get! Sadly no custom pour overs.  The coffee was alright, a bit underextracted. The service was friendly, didn't try the pastries.  Would recommend a visit for sure!

Absolute amazing restaurant, service and food!!! Me and my boyfriend, Stephen, came for a special occasion and had one of the best dining experiences we've ever had. The 13 course tasting with wine pairing was well paced and everything was delicious. Would definetly recommend and will return!
Lovely light roast espresso served on the Slayer.
Excellent!

This is an amazing spot to stop for quality coffee and espresso drinks on Barracks Row. Not surprising given it's a project of the owner of the amazing Rose's Luxury right next door.  They also have a very small lunch menu with just 3-4 items, but each of them are AMAZING. I highly recommend either the fried chicken sandwich or the green garbanzo falafel sandwich. Both have incredible flavor profiles and must be experienced.
Awesome restaurant.  Worth the hefty price tag.
Delicious brunch sandwiches, coffee, and cinnamon rolls.
Think getting engaged, celebrating lottery winnings, and important birthdays...  Outstanding.
Very friendly and pastries look and taste great! Glad I had the opportunity to stop by.
Tasty pastries and sandwiches,  great coffee and very friendly peoplr!  A happy place...

Before you pick up your lap top bag and head over to Barracks Row hottest, newest coffee shop, just know that Pineapple & Pearls is a walk up coffee shop meaning there is absolutely NO seating and therefore no public wifi. If you know that going in, you'll have right expectations and will most likely LOVE this place.  As DC continues to "New Yorkify" (Thanks to Maketto for starting that movement), it only seems appropriate for Pineapple a& Pearls to open. It's a small coffee shop/pastry walk in from, by, and right next door to Rose's Luxury. It's simple and chic like New York City using a neo-modern beach theme. It's reminiscent of high class Charleston.  The two staff members behind the white marble counter are friendly and they may ask you if you've been in before, but not in a way that's a question. They ask it as if you for sure have been in before, but you haven't. Psychologically that makes you feel more connected to them as if they think you're familiar. It gives you a real sense that you are in fact invited and welcomed at Pineapple & Pearls. Even as a student of psychology, I fell for it and am already planning on my next visit.  They sell quality, artisan coffee as the Peregrine-esque menu boards tells you. However, unlike nearby Peregrine, Pineapple & Pearls sells chai latte and a darn good one at that. They also sell 6 pastries most of which are of the cinnamon roll variety. If you like chocolate and a little kick in the morning, order the Mexican chocolate cinnamon roll. It will come out from the oven warm oozing with Mexican chocolate. They'll give it to you in a clean, white bag, but ask for napkins....LOTS of them. You'll need it to wipe off the warm Mexican chocolate from your lips, chin, and in my case my eyebrow (I still don't know how that happened).  Pineapple & Pearls- Welcome to DC. I wouldn't be surprised if you get named "Best New Coffee Shop in the USA." After all, you are the child of Rose's Luxury. Way to live up to the expectation and hype!  Now I need to go continue wiping that Mexican chocolate from my brow.
Solid coffee and tasty, albeit limited, sandwich selection. The rolls were too doughy but the service was excellent.
